CP Violation is an underrated track

this review was a long time coming, this is quite literally the only game i have ever beaten multiple times just because its so goddamn fun and engaging, not to mention the story is absolutely godly, with so much attention to detail and a physics engine that still makes modern games look stupid in comparison. if you haven't played this yet, you really should.

the main focus is really the story as it is, still not exaggerating, one of the best i've played. the characters are realistic and great, and its incredibly easy to get immersed in the atmosphere (some would complain about a silent protagonist, but i see this as a way to more easily fit yourself into the world of the game). its sad, scary, and funny all when it wants to be, and its incredibly good at presentation and world building. truly impressive.

combat is probably a low point. its still quite fun and engaging but its not exactly impressive. the game more than makes up for this however by giving you an insane variety of environments, enemies, and most importantly, puzzles. every encounter might as well be a self contained puzzle as you'll have to think about the environment, your arsenal, and what you can use to your advantage. you'll be doing a lot of thinking.

overall, a very old game that still holds up to this day. i'd say its a perfect 10/10

This is an amazing game that was truly revolutionary for its time and still holds up today, almost 17 years later. There is a blast of fun to be had here, and I would recommend this to anyone regardless of his or her preference in video-games.

Good story, and good characters. Sadly it is full of bugs, and it doesn't show you where to go or what to do in order to go to somewhere, so it becomes quite difficult to find out where your supposed to be going. This game has so many concepts of rooms and objects from newer games, like Turrets from Portal and Zombies from Left 4 Dead. This game is underrated, its better than most people think it is.
